headline: Retail winners & losers as Black Friday nears
summary: As Black Friday approaches, retail stocks are on the move with earnings reports released Tuesday for major retailers including Dick's Sporting Goods (DKS), Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF), and Best Buy (BBY). Strategic Resource Group Founder Burt Flickinger joins Asking for a Trend Host Josh Lipton to break down the retail winners and losers, consumer behavior, and broader industry trends. Flickinger underscores that in a challenging retail environment, where consumers are increasingly budget-conscious, the winners are going to be “necessary” retailers in the food sector, like Kroger (KR) and Costco (COST). Tune in to the video above for more insights into the shopping trends shaping the year ahead. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend here. This post was written by Cindy Mizaku.

headline: Institutional investors have a lot riding on The Kroger Co. (NYSE:KR) with 76% ownership
summary: Key Insights Significantly high institutional ownership implies Kroger's stock price is sensitive to their trading...

headline: Kroger price target raised to $63 from $61 at Guggenheim
summary: Guggenheim analyst John Heinbockel raised the firm’s price target on Kroger (KR) to $63 from $61 and keeps a Buy rating on the shares. The firm cites modest macro exposure, both in terms of product assortment and demographics, “still-skeptical Street expectations,” and a “reasonable” multiple in support of its Buy rating, adding that it sees a likely in-line Q3 print and tightened full-year guidance upcoming on December 5. headline: Circana names Kroger exec Stuart Aitken president and CEO
summary: Aitken, currently the grocer’s chief merchandising and marketing officer, will become the leader of the retail data analytics company on Jan. 1, 2025.
